title.rendered: Round 3: Wrangler NFR LIVE Las Vegas Rodeo Today 12/10/2023

content.rendered:
Get ready for another thrilling night of rodeo action as the 2023 Wrangler National Finals Rodeo (NFR) presented by Teton Ridge continues with Round 3 on Sunday, December 10th, 2023. The competition heats up at the Thomas & Mack Center in Las Vegas, Nevada, with cowboys and cowgirls battling it out for the coveted NFR championship titles.

Here’s what you need to know about WRANGLER NFR Round 3:

Date: Saturday, December 10, 2023
Time: 8:45 PM ET
Location: Thomas & Mack Center, Las Vegas, Nevada
Events: Bareback Riding, Steer Wrestling, Team Roping, Saddle Bronc Riding, Tie-Down Roping, Barrel Racing, Bull Riding

Stream the Wrangler NFR Round 3 LIVE from Las Vegas: Start your free trial today!

Don’t miss a single moment of the action! Tune in live on The Cowboy Channel or catch the livestream on cowboychannelplus.com. For those in the USA, SlingTV also offers streaming access. If you’re watching internationally, ExpressVPN lets you tune in from anywhere.

Wrangler NFR Round 2 Results, Dec. 9

Bareback Riding: Second round: 1. Rocker Shane Steiner, 88.5 points on Sankey Pro Rodeo & Phenom Genetics’ Mustard, $30,706; 2. Cole Reiner, 86.5, $24,268; 3. Jess Pope, 84.5, $18,325; 4. (tie) Tanner Aus and Richmond Champion, 84, $10,401 each; 6. (tie) Kade Sonnier, Clayton Biglow, and Leighton Berry, 83.5, $1,651 each; 9. Mason Clements, 83; 10. (tie) Keenan Hayes and Tim O’Connell, 82.5 each; 12. (tie) Orin Larsen and Jayco Roper, 79 each; 14. Dean Thompson, 77.5; 15. Jacob Lees, 74. Average leaders: 1. Rocker Shane Steiner, 175.5 points on two head; 2. Jess Pope, 169.5; 3. Clayton Biglow, 169; 4. Richmond Champion, 167.5; 5. (tie) Leighton Berry and Cole Reiner, 167 each; 7. (tie) Keenan Hayes, Mason Clements and Tanner Aus, 166 each; 10. (tie) Kade Sonnier and Tim O’Connell, 163 each; 12. Jayco Roper, 162.5; 13. Orin Larsen, 157.5; 14. Jacob Lees, 156.5; 15. Dean Thompson, 155. World Standings: 1. Keenan Hayes, $282,334; 2. Rocker Shane Steiner, $214,536; 3. Clayton Biglow, $198,657; 4. Leighton Berry, $176,045; 5. Jess Pope, $173,697; 6. Kade Sonnier, $172,120; 7. Tim O’Connell, $169,326; 8. Orin Larsen, $157,237; 9. Cole Reiner, $152,488; 10. Jayco Roper, $144,406; 11. Dean Thompson, $141,452; 12. Tanner Aus, $140,297; 13. Richmond Champion, $138,527; 14. Mason Clements, $136,166; 15. Jacob Lees, $127,808.

Steer Wrestling: Second round: 1. Stan Branco, 3.9 seconds, $30,706; 2. (tie) Jesse Brown and J.D. Struxness, 4.1, $21,296 each; 4. Dirk Tavenner, 4.2, $12,877; 5. Nick Guy, 4.3, $7,924; 6. (tie) Tyler Waguespack and Stephen Culling, 4.4, $2,476 each; 8. (tie) Dalton Massey, Dakota Eldridge and Don Payne, 4.5 each; 11. Cody Devers, 4.7; 12. Jacob Talley, 7.5; 13. Ty Erickson, 8.3; 14. Will Lummus, 13.8; 15. Bridger Anderson, NT.  Average leaders: 1. Dalton Massey, 8.0 seconds on two head; 2. Tyler Waguespack, 8.2; 3. J.D. Struxness, 8.7; 4. Don Payne, 8.8; 5. Nick Guy, 8.9; 6.
